intro: Godetia grandiflora, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 inches and thrives in well-drained soils. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing showy flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Godetia grandiflora is also known for its ability to self-seed and is often found in open fields and along roadsides.
